item.title: Linear Models for Regression - Bayesian Model Comparison
item.description: 3.4 Bayesian Model Comparison Here we consider the problem of model selection from a Bayesian perspective. The Bayesian view of model comparison simply involves the use of probabilities to represent uncertainty in the choice of model. Suppose we wish to compare a set of $L$ models ${M_i}$ where $i = 1,…,L$. Here a model refers to a probability distribution over the observed data $D$. We shall suppose that the data is generated from one of these models but we are uncertain which one.
